name: Fiesta Tater Tot® Casserole
author: 2macs114
summary: We invented this recipe one night after one of us wanted Tater Tot® casserole for supper, while the other wanted Mexican...It's SUPER easy and SUPER yummy! Baking the Tater Tots® before layering may be unnecessary but we wanted to make sure they had a chance to crisp up. The whole family LOVED this dish! Hope you do too!
ingredients: 1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix, divided
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed nacho cheese soup (such as Campbell's® Fiesta Nacho Cheese Soup)
1 (32 ounce) package frozen bite-size potato nuggets (such as Tater Tots®)
1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and stir in ground beef, green onion, and 1/2 package
Cook and stir mixture until the beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink, about 10 minutes
Drain and discard any excess grease
Combine remaining taco seasoning mix with tomato soup, nacho cheese soup, and milk in a saucepan; heat soup mixture until just boiling
Layer potato nuggets in the prepared casserole dish
Bake in the preheated oven until potato nuggets begin to crisp, about 10 minutes
Spoon ground beef mixture over potato nuggets; pour in soup mixture
Bake until soup mixture is bubbling, 15 to 20 minutes
Sprinkle casserole with Mexican cheese blend; bake until cheese is melted, 5 to 10 minutes
